page.title: 08Shopping in the Rural Area
page.content: After a lapse of 4 years the village shop opened again 3 years ago and is much appreciated. It is well stocked and run by a friendly concerned ex - nurse;it is a meeting place particularly as newspapers and magazines are collected daily.The business just pays for itself and the prices are not high,but fortunately the post office section is profitable and anything which altered that would have a detrimental effect on the whole community. There is also a travelling grocer,a local greengrocer,butcher,a fresh fish van and 2 fish & chip vans.Rington's tea and the mobile library call fortnightly.Nosterfield relies entirely on these travelling shops.The nearest supermarkets are in Bedale and Ripon but Masham (4.5kms) has a useful range of shops.
